Dear Ms. Idziak:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on . Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan
department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent
agency in the country where the
person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be
a perpetrator of child abuse or child
neglect. The documentation shall be
completed not more than 30 days prior

to the start of employment and every
12 months thereafter.
Two out of seven new employee files reviewed did not have a central registry
clearance completed within 30 days of the staff's hire date. One staff member
was hired on 4/3/23, but her central registry clearance was completed on 3/3/23,
which is 31 days. The facility hired the other staff member on 9/5/23 and allowed
the staff member to work without an approved central registry clearance. The
facility emailed DCWL GOA the forms on 8/24/23, and the GOA emailed the
facility on 8/28/23 notifying them she could not open the attachments. The facility
never returned the forms, so DCWL never approved the staff member to begin
working at the facility.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the
completion of the probationary period or
within 180 days, whichever is less, and a
written evaluation of the employee’s
performance annually thereafter.
Two of three seasoned employee's files did not have an annual evaluation
completed. One staff's annual evaluation was due in July 2023 and one staff's
annual evaluation was due in November 2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The facility was provided information about background clearance timeframes
and what to do if the central registry checks are getting close to 30 days old.
 The facility was informed if they have a supervisor leave, they need a process to
view, track, and complete annual evaluations for employees.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require any consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD

Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The facility's budget and financial audit were reviewed. There were no concerns
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) noted the last audit resulted in no findings and there have
been no identified areas of non-compliance over the last year. CA did not identify
any barriers or systemic factors impacting statute, rule, MISEP, policy and/or
contract compliance. CA reported there were no unplanned discharges during the
period of review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported the support they all provide for each other and receive from
supervisor’s is excellent. They reported they feel things amongst staff are
consistent and structured because they do not have a lot of turnover. They
reported they feel they have enough training and adequate training to complete
their position requirements. They reported they have enough resources to help
and support the youth at the facility. One staff member reported they love the staff
recognition and praise during staff meetings. However, the staff member wants to
ensure staff who always go above and beyond are also recognized for "the little
things" because a lot of times, the little things make the biggest impact in the
facility's daily functioning and success. Supervisor reported the direct care staff do
a great job of handling things independently without always involving managers,
which speaks to their work ethic and confidence in their positions.
Youth interviews were conducted. Youth feel staff interact appropriately with them,
care about them and keep them safe. They reported they have enough food at the
facility, and they like the food provided. One youth reported she doesn't have the
freedom she wishes to have and does not feel safe with one of the other youth in
the home.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility was completed on December
18, 2023. There were no safety concerns observed.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
